clinical_study.brief_title: Misoprostol for Second Trimester Termination of Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: Mifepristone (RU 486) and Misoprostol for Second Trimester Termination of Pregnancy. A Comparison of Two Different Dose Regimens.

lead_sponsor.agency: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

clinical_study.source: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the efficacy of two different dose regimens of misoprostol administered vaginally in combination with mifepristone in second trimester termination of (non)viable pregnancy.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was designed as a prospective double blinded randomised controlled trial, comparing 200µg to 400 µg misoprostol given vaginally at four hour intervals, starting 36-48 hours after the oral administration of mifepristone 200 mg at a gestational age between 14 to 24 weeks.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Expulsion rate and the number of incomplete abortions warranting surgical evacuation of retained products of conception.

secondary_outcome.measure: time between the first administration of misoprostol to to delivery of the foetus

intervention.description: mifepristone 200 mg followed by 200 µg misoprostol per vaginam 36- 48 hours later at 4 hourly intervals (with a maximum of 10 administrations in 48 hours) until the foetus was delivered.
mifepristone 200 mg followed by 400 µg misoprostol per vaginam 36- 48 hours later at 4 hourly intervals (with a maximum of 10 administrations in 48 hours) until the foetus was delivered.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women with a gestational age between 14 to 24 weeks, confirmed by ultrasound, requesting termination of pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- No informed consent
- Mifepristone allergy
- Chronic adrenal gland failure
- Kidney failure
- Liver failure
- Chronic use of corticosteroids
- COPD not responsive to treatment
- Cardiovascular disease
- Glaucoma
